Posts.Content: I'm no doctor but I can tell you this. No malignancy... praise God!! That means no cancer. I have an intraductal papilloma too and my doctor tells me (I have seen a breast surgeon as well) that nothing has to be done about it. A papilloma is a wartlike growth near the nipple, and you can get some nipple discharge with it, sometimes a little bit of pain. I understand your emotions. When I had my needle biopsy I was so surprised that I honestly didn't even feel it much at ALL. I was worried about nothing, and thankfully my results were benign and it was just a cyst. blessings, Sue
Posts.Title: Microcalcifications + subtle papilloma

Posts.Content: The above is a great answer. I would not worry excessively, but I would also not ignore this, considering that your mom had breast cancer. My sister has (since a teenager) fibroadenomas. They are bean shaped, on the side of each of her breasts, and they don't hurt and are movable. It's totally benign, if you have this. Of course, you want to be super sure. If I were you? I'd go to another doctor for another exam, and a fresh set of hands. If they say you're fine, don't sweat it anymore. Sue
Posts.Title: Identical Lumps (Several On Both Breasts)

Posts.Content: Anytime, Liz, I really DO care. I have calcifications in both breasts so just know that not all calcifications mean trouble. I do sympathize that you're concerned, that's only natural. Keep me posted!! God bless, Sue
Posts.Title: Inconclusive Digital Mammogram

Posts.Content: I'm around your age, also with cystic breasts, and I wouldnt worry about it. In my opinion it shows that your mammo place is a good one.
Posts.Title: Inconclusive Digital Mammogram

Posts.Content: What wonderful news!!! I couldn't be happier for you !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Posts.Title: Inconclusive Digital Mammogram

Posts.Content: I'm so glad!! Wishing you the very best. Let me know when you find out that everything's okay. :-) Sue
Posts.Title: Inconclusive Digital Mammogram

Posts.Content: Mine had a finding too. They called it a "density". Turned out that it was a totally benign cyst. At our ages, that's pretty common. I had a painless needle biopsy. I'm sorry you're so worried, there are still many reasons why it can just be a technical error. Sue
Posts.Title: Inconclusive Digital Mammogram

Posts.Content: Turns out that my dense tissue is a small cyst. Mammograms exhibit cysts as density, yet the ultrasound I had last week showed very clearly that it is a cyst. I'm going for a FNA (fine needle aspiration) this morning.
Posts.Title: "asymmetric" mammogram result

Posts.Content: I have had discharge, but mine is not what I would call bloody. It is more orange in color. My issue is very benign, I have a papilloma. It's sort of a wart near the nipple, doctor says that nothing needs to be done. I'm glad you are having yours checked out...breast health is so very important. Sorry I couldn't help but I wish you the very best. Please let us know what the doctor says, okay? blessings, Sue
Posts.Title: Non-spontaneous bloody nipple discharge?

Posts.Content: wishing you a benign result. The waiting is the worst part!! Let us know.... blessings, Sue
Posts.Title: waiting for biopsy

Posts.Content: I know that the economic price is steep, but this is your LIFE we're talking about! If I were you I would have the biopsy done. That way you can enjoy the upcoming holidays knowing you are perfectly fine, instead of wondering, each and every day.
Posts.Title: Needle Biopsy or Wait 6 Months?

Posts.Content: It could very well just be a papilloma. They are totally benign. Go for a check up and try not to worry.
Posts.Title: lump on my right breast

Posts.Content: Just an update in case someone else ever looks for this information.. my cyst was benign.
Posts.Title: "asymmetric" mammogram result

Posts.Content: My mammogram report says that there is an area of asymmetry in my right breast. I don't feel any lumps and was checked by my gynecologist just a few months ago. I go back for another mammogram and an ultrasound on Tuesday. I have calcifications in each breast for many years now and I go for annual mammograms. This is the first time anything out of the ordinary came up. Is it possible that this was determined because of the (bad) technique of the technician who did the mammogram? Has anyone had anything that was described as "asymmetric"? What was your diagnosis? Thanks.
Posts.Title: "asymmetric" mammo result

Posts.Content: My mammogram report says that there is an area of asymmetry in my right breast. I don't feel any lumps and was checked by my gynecologist just a few months ago. I go back for another mammogram and an ultrasound on Tuesday. I have calcifications in each breast for many years now and I go for annual mammograms. This is the first time anything out of the ordinary came up. Is it possible that this was determined because of the (bad) technique of the technician who did the mammogram? Has anyone had anything that was described as "asymmetric"? What was your diagnosis? Thanks.
Posts.Title: "asymmetric" mammogram result

Posts.Content: I hope they've already gotten back to you. Most breast lumps are totally benign...I believe I recently read over 80% of them! Good for you that you noticed a change and called right away. If no one gets back to you, call your internist's office. best wishes, Sue
Posts.Title: Does anyone respond?

Posts.Content: You know what I think? Don't let it slide. I think that you should HARASS them with a phone call each day, I'm not kidding you! If God forbid something is wrong, time is of the essence. Don't worry about being "nice", okay? This is your health and you are entitled to some information already. ARGH !! Sue
Posts.Title: Does anyone respond?

Posts.Content: My understanding is that these are all terms that have to do with certain densities that are described from the actual sonogram waves themselves. I hope you're not overly worried about the aspiration- it was absolutely painless for me and was over in a couple of seconds. Good luck to you, keep us posted. Sue
Posts.Title: Mammogram / Ultrasound Report Question
